name: tenanted
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A tenanted building or tenanted land has a tenant (= a person who pays rent for its use): Every piece of property he owns is tenanted. It turned out the house was on tenanted farmland. Compare
untenanted
More examplesFewer examplesThe majority of the pubs are leased and tenanted.Many landowners sold their tenanted land.The agency specializes in tenanted residential properties.I have a cottage in the village, but it's tenanted at the moment.He had been brought up on a tenanted farm and was sensitive to the power of the landowner.

Add to word list
PROPERTY used to describe a building or land that a person or organization pays rent to use: The developer recently purchased a chain of tenanted pubs.
